subject: Politics
title: Fiscal Conservatism
description: A quick win: understand Fiscal Conservatism.

hook.text: Fiscal conservatives have a simple message: the government spends too much of your money. Cut taxes. Cut spending.

buildup.text: Fiscal conservatism wants balanced budgets, low taxes, and minimal government intervention in the economy.

discovery.text: Supply-side economics argues that cutting taxes boosts growth, which raises revenue. Reaganomics tested this.

twist.text: In practice, fiscal conservatives often cut taxes but not spending. Deficits grew under Reagan and Trump.

climax.text: Austerity policies after 2008 cut services to balance budgets. Growth stalled and public anger surged.

punchline.text: Fiscal conservatives preach discipline. In office, they often spend differently.

quiz.question: What is supply-side economics?
options: The theory that cutting taxes boosts growth and raises revenue
The idea that government spending drives economic growth
A plan to nationalize all private industries
